title: Troubleshooting Valve Issues Using A Voltmeter

tasks.task: Troubleshoot issues with a malfunctioning sprinkler zone using a voltmeter.
subtasks: Ensure proper testing tools: multimeter (voltmeter) or solenoid activator.
Check if the issue is a valve problem.
For a zone not stopping: replace the valve if not closing fully.
For a zone not coming on fully: replace the valve if not opening fully.
For a zone not coming on: check controller, modules, and programming.
Understand the controller's role in activating the valve.
Measure voltage between common terminal and zone terminal on the controller.
Check resistance between common and zone terminals on controller if voltage is low.
Test solenoid resistance using multimeter: 20-60 ohms for AC systems, 5 ohms for DC.
Replace solenoid/valve if resistance is low (bad solenoid).
Check wiring for voltage: 20-30 volts AC.
Identify and fix wiring issues, such as loose connections or corrosion.
Use a doubler to operate two valves with one lead wire if needed.
